page.title: 10SHAWHEAD VILLAGE HALL
page.content:
In 1909 Mr and Mrs Adamson gave two generous donations adding up to Â£120 towards the building of the hall. The total cost of building the hall was Â£500. Mr James Clark McGeorge donated the land that the hall was built on.
The hall was opened as a public library as well as a hall on the 22nd December 1911. The hall used to have 4 fireplaces and the benches were kept in a hut that belonged to the hall.
The hall is used for a lot of things now. There is a playgroup on Tuesdays and Thursdays, badminton on Mondays and Wednesdays, bowling on Thursdays and football on Saturdays. The Youth Club meets in the hall on Fridays during the winter months.
